intro: If you’re looking for a fun drawing game to whip out the next time you’re with a group of friends, Pictionary is a classic that you should definitely try out. In Pictionary, everyone takes turns drawing a picture that represents a word to make the rest of their team guess it correctly. It’s fast-paced, extremely fun, and super easy to learn. We know you’re excited to start sketching and get your game night started, so keep reading for all the rules you’ll need to play!

steps.title: Clarify how precise an answer should be before you start.
steps.subtitle: Chat with your friends about house rules right away so you don’t get into a dispute later in the game. Discuss if players need to say the full prompt to win a round or if you’ll accept shortened or partial answers.
sub-points: If the prompt is “bunk bed,” decide if someone answering “bunk” is OK.
You may decide “floss” is an acceptable answer for the prompt “dental floss.”

steps.title: Reach the Finish square and guess one more drawing correctly to win.
steps.subtitle: The Finish square is at the end of the game board. After a team moves onto the square, they sketch one more prompt. If the team guesses the prompt, then they immediately win the game.
sub-points: The Finish space is usually an “All Play,” so another team could answer the prompt first and prevent a team from winning.
If the team isn’t able to answer the prompt, then they have to wait until their next turn to try winning again.
